page.title: 15DOGMERSFIELD HOUSE:HOUSE
page.content: The present Manor of Dogmersfield was erected by Ellis St John, the main front in 1728 and the great west wing in 1744.Sir Henry Paulet St John married Jane Mildmay in 1786 and adopted her name. The Manor remained in the family till 1933, when it was occupied by Reed's School.In 1956 the De La Salle Brothers took it over as a Roman Catholic training seminary until Daneshill School moved in in 1973.They left in 1979. In 1981 two thirds of the building was destroyed by fire. In 1983 confirmed plans were made to preserve the 1728 north front. The building is now the European headquarters of Amdahl International, a leading American computer company. 1985 sees the reconstruction of the west wing and new additions are planned.
